moves.1... f5: The Dutch, this should be fun
moves.2. Nf3 Nf6 3. Bf4: So I just keep within the London system idea
moves.5. Nbd2 Bb7 6. Bd3 Be7 7. c3 O-O 8. h3: I decide to create an escape square for the bishop and am considering castling long
moves.8... Na6: I guess black is thinking of playing c5, I'm having non of it and am going to start to charge down the king side
moves.9. g4 Nd5 10. Qe2: I decide to let the bishop go, but it does look messy
moves.10... Nxf4 11. exf4 Qc8: I am not sure of blacks idea here, but it allows white to continue
moves.14... Re8 15. Ne5: Surprise, and Black plays the very natural d6
moves.17... Qb8: Black moves the quenn away from the action
moves.18. fxe5 c5: Black is trying to create some room but it is too late
moves.19. Qxh7+ Kf8 20. exf6: White has a won game and black resigns
